title: President Trump Signs Executive Order Attempting To Control Social Media
text: President Donald Trump has signed an executive order that calls for regulating online censorship on social media platforms, primarily Facebook and Twitter, both of which are called out by name on the order.

title: Judge Napolitano: Trump’s social media executive order is ‘totally out of line’
text: Fox News senior judicial analyst Judge Andrew Napolitano and Fortune executive editor Adam Lashinsky discuss the social media executive order President Trump signed.

title: Trump's war on social media will likely fail, NY Time's Jim Stewart says
text: James Stewart, NY Times columnist, discusses the White House crackdown on social media. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Guy Adami, Dan Nathan and Pete Najarian.

title: Zuckerberg defends Facebook from Trump’s crackdown and everything else you missed: CNBC After Hours
text: CNBC.com’s MacKenzie Sigalos brings you the day’s top business news headlines, and what to watch as the coronavirus pandemic continues to keep most of America on lockdown.

title: Trump Signs Executive Order to Limit Editorial Powers of Social Media Services
text: Executive Order 13925 could open up social networks to legal liability claims.

text: President Trump signs an executive order to address his concerns about social media.

text: Jeffrey Sonnenfield, Yale School of Management Senior Associate Dean for Leadership Studies, joins "Closing Bell" to talk about President Trump's social media executive order.

title: President Trump signs executive order targeting social media after Twitter feud
text: The president threatened to “strongly regulate, or close them down” on Wednesday.

title: Trump signs an executive order that takes aim at social media companies
text: On Thursday, President Trump signed an executive order taking aim at the legal shield that internet companies rely on to protect them from liability for user-created content. That law, known as Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act is essential to large social platforms like Twitter, YouTube and Facebook, the kind of companies the president […]

title: Donald Trump Signs Executive Order Targeting Social Media Platforms: “They’ve Had Unchecked Power”
text: President Donald Trump signed an executive order targeting social media companies, claiming that sites like Twitter and Facebook have “unchecked power” to censor and restrict points of view. The text of the order was not immediately released, but a draft circulated earlier on Wednesday showed that it would ask the FCC to review whether tech

title: Trump signs executive order targeting Twitter, Facebook after his tweets are fact checked
text: The order comes after Twitter labeled the president's tweets about mail-in ballots for containing "potentially misleading information."

title: Former FB chief privacy officer: White House has authority to crack down on social media companies
text: Chris Kelly, Facebook’s former chief privacy officer and first general counsel, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss the state of the social media regulation.

title: Twitter literally wrote a new rule for Trump: CNBC tech editor
text: President Trump has threatened regulation of social media companies. Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg weighed in on the debate on 'Squawk Box.' CNBC's Andrew Ross Sorkin and CNBC tech editor Steve Kovach join 'Power Lunch' to discuss the debate.

title: 'We're fed up with it': Trump signs order aimed at curtailing social media companies
text: Donald Trump has signed an executive order aimed at curbing protections for social media giants.

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg Talks Working From Home, Fact-Checking Trump

text: President Donald Trump's signing of an executive order on social-media companies is being planned for Thursday afternoon

title: Facebook Still Has What It Takes to Power Through Trump’s Threats
text: President Trump is angry with social media platforms. However, can he really hurt FB stock and its peers or is it just a smokescreen?

title: Facebook and Its Secret Policies
text: Facebook should be making its policy choices in fair and transparent ways. But is it?

title: Trump's crackdown on Big Tech is misguided
text: President Trump loves to boast about how well the stock market has done during his tenure. That makes his recent threats to rein in big tech and social media firms all the more puzzling.

title: Pelosi accuses Facebook of pandering to White House
text: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi answers reporter's question on Trump's executive order aimed at social media companies at her weekly press conference.

text: President Trump will sign an executive order on Thursday, cracking down on social media platforms Facebook and Twitter.

text: President announced plan to strip social media companies of liability protections after Twitter factchecked his tweets

title: 3 Social Media Stocks to Trade Out of the Covid-19 Crisis
text: Social media stocks are in demand as Wall Street is loving the idea of betting on companies that benefited from the quarantine.

title: Trump targets social media in new executive order
text: The Trump administration plans to crack down on social media platforms after Twitter's decision to fact check the president's tweets about mail-in ballots.

title: Trump's Executive Order To Expose Social Media To Lawsuits Over Content Policies
text: President Donald Trump is scheduled to sign an executive order that would expose social media companies to lawsuits related to content curation and site moderation, according to CNN.

title: Cramer: Trump executive order the beginning of social media regulation

text: CNBC's Ylan Mui reports details on President Trump's planned executive order on regulating social media.

title: Trump executive order takes aim at social media firms: draft
text: U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to order a review of a law that has long protected Twitter, Facebook and Alphabet's Google from being responsible for the material posted by their users, according to a draft executive order and a source familiar with the situation.

title: Tech Companies Aren't 'State Actors,' Judge Dismisses Conservative Bias Lawsuit Against Facebook, Twitter, Google, Apple
text: The United States appeals court in Washington, D.C. has dismissed a 2018 lawsuit that accused top tech and social media companies of undermining users' First Amendment rights, TechCrunch reported Wednesday.

title: Facebook’s Zuckerberg backs Trump over Dorsey in Twitter fact-check feud
text:
Zuckerberg told Fox News that social media companies shouldn’t be the “arbiters of truth.”
Yesterday President Trump unloaded a string of attacks on social media companies in response to Twitter issuing its first-ever fact-check on one of his tweets.

title: Watch CNBC's full interview with Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg joined CNBC's Andrew Ross Sorkin to discuss the future of remote work, Big Tech's role in fact checking politicians, the impact on small businesses and more.

title: Trump expected to sign executive order aimed at cracking down on Facebook and Twitter, reports say
text: The debate over online content has taken on new urgency in the run-up to the 2020 elections, in which both parties have found reasons to angry over online content.

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg: Social networks should not fact-check politicians
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg spoke with CNBC's Andrew Ross Sorkin about what he thought of Twitter's move to fact check President Trump's tweets and the role social media platforms play in regulating misinformation online.

title: Facebook and Twitter shares fall as Trump targets social media
text: US President Donald Trump is going to battle against Twitter and Facebook — a move that could weigh on companies whose shares have so far outperformed during the pandemic.

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg on the advantages of a remote workforce
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg predicts in the next five to ten years that half of the company's nearly 50,000 employees will work remotely.

title: Mark Zuckerberg says social networks should not be fact-checking political speech
text: Facebook CEO tells CNBC's Andrew Ross Sorkin, "Political speech is one of the most sensitive parts in a democracy, and people should be able to see what politicians say."

title: Trump’s Executive Order On Social Media Could Cut Legal Protections For Twitter And Facebook
text: A leaked draft of the EO shows companies could be made more vulnerable to claims of censorship from federal regulators.

title: Facebook has 'No Meeting Wednesdays' to help people feel OK about working from home
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg explains to Andrew Ross Sorkin the benefits and drawbacks of the company's plan to make up to half its workforce remote.

title: Trump to sign executive order on social media companies
text: Donald Trump is to sign an executive order on social media companies, White House officials have said.
